intro: Pleroma rubrum, commonly known as the red bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are upright and branching. Pleroma rubrum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
